content.json: # Azure Monitor Starter Packs - Extended Admin Centre - V2.2

## General Parameters

### Subscriptions

Select the Subscriptions that will be used in the Configuration

### Logic App

Select the logic app to be used. Typically the shoulbe a single one but if more instances exist, select the one for the instance you want to use.

### Function Apps

Select the Backend Function to be used. Typically the shoulbe a single one but if more instances exist, select the one for the instance you want to use.

### Config Function Key

This field will be automatically populated once the function is selected.

### Workspace

Select the Log Analytics Workspace to be used for this instance.

### Azure Managed Grafana

Select the Azure Managed Grafana if you have deployed one along with the solution.

content.json: # Getting Started Welcome to the Azure Monitoring Packs. This workbook was designed to help you configuring the solution. Here you can: - Enable/Disable monitoring packs for one or more VMs or services. You may also disable all the monitoring for a specific server or service. This will remove the tags and the rule associations. For services, right now, the alerts wont be deleted by themselves. - Enable/Disable Alerts in bulk. You can also assign a different Action group to one or more alerts or delete the rules** - Check policy status and start remediation if required. By clicking in a policy, you can also assign that policy to another scope. - Check Monitor pack associations. - Review discovered applications (VMs only) - Manage agent configuration (install/remove) ## Link to your managed [Grafana]({GrafanaInstance:label}) instance, if you enabled it. Make sure to property set permissions before attemping to access it. ## If this is the first time using this solution, please configure the parameters in the ***Configuration*** tab and save the workbook for proper functionality. ## Please check the Monitoring Packs repository for updates. [Azure MONitor STARter Packs](http://github.com/Azure/AzureMonitorStarterPacks) ## Also check the Azure Monitor Baseline Alerts ([AMBA](http://aka.ms/amba)) website for the details on the alerts.

## IaaS Information

The summary below shows details related to the IaaS Monitoring packs.

content.query:
resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines' or type =~ 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines'
| extend MonitorStatus=iff(isnotempty(tostring(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)),'Monitored','Not Monitored')
| summarize count() by MonitorStatus
content.title: Monitoring Status (Tags)

content.query:
Resources
| where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines'
| extend
    JoinID = toupper(id)
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where ( type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions') and name in ('AzureMonitorLinuxAgent', 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent')
    | extend
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        ExtensionName = name
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId
| union (Resources
| where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend
    JoinID = toupper(id)
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions' and name in ('AzureMonitorLinuxAgent', 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent')
    | extend
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        ExtensionName = name
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId)
| summarize count() by AgentInstalled=iff(isempty(ExtensionName),"No","Yes")
content.title: Agent Install Status

content.query:
policyresources | where type == "microsoft.policyinsights/policystates" | extend policyName=tostring(properties.policyDefinitionName), complianceState=properties.complianceState
| join (policyresources | where type == "microsoft.authorization/policydefinitions" and isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks) | project policyId=id, policyName=name, pack=tostring(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)) on policyName
| project policyId, policyName, complianceState=tostring(complianceState), pack,type='Policy'
| union( policyresources
| where type =~ 'Microsoft.PolicyInsights/PolicyStates'
| extend complianceState = tostring(properties.complianceState)
| extend
	resourceId = tostring(properties.resourceId),
	policyAssignmentId = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentId),
	policyAssignmentScope = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentScope),
	policyAssignmentName = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentName),
	policyDefinitionId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionId),
    policySetDefinitionId=tostring(properties.policySetDefinitionId),
	policyDefinitionReferenceId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionReferenceId),
	stateWeight = iff(complianceState == 'NonCompliant', int(300), iff(complianceState == 'Compliant', int(200), iff(complianceState == 'Conflict', int(100), iff(complianceState == 'Exempt', int(50), int(0)))))
| summarize max(stateWeight) by resourceId, policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| summarize counts = count() by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, max_stateWeight, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| summarize overallStateWeight = max(max_stateWeight),
nonCompliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 300),
compliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 200),
conflictCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 100),
exemptCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 50) by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| extend totalResources = todouble(nonCompliantCount + compliantCount + conflictCount + exemptCount)
| extend compliancePercentage = iff(totalResources == 0, todouble(100), 100 * todouble(compliantCount + exemptCount) / totalResources)
| project policyAssignmentName, scope = policyAssignmentScope,policySetDefinitionId,
complianceState = iff(overallStateWeight == 300, 'nonCompliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 200, 'Compliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 100, 'conflict', iff(overallStateWeight == 50, 'exempt', 'notstarted')))),
compliancePercentage,
compliantCount,
nonCompliantCount,
conflictCount,
exemptCount
| where isnotempty(policySetDefinitionId)
| join (policyresources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions' and isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)
| extend policySetDefinitionId=tostring(id)) on policySetDefinitionId
| project policyId=policySetDefinitionId, policyName=name,complianceState,pack='N/A', type='Set')
| summarize count() by complianceState,policyName
content.title: Assignment Policies Status

content.query:

| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionruleassociations"

| summarize by Pack=MPs,rulename=tostring(name)) on rulename
| project-away rulename,rulename1,resourceId
| summarize Associated=count() by Pack
| sort by Pack asc

content.json:
## Server Monitoring Setup

Select servers on the right to assign a pack. Once the backend is done with the assigning, the server will show on the left side grid.

On the left side grid, the monitoring can be updated to add more packs, as well as to remove a specific pack or remove any monitoring altogether from the server.
When Monitoring is first enabled, the Azure Monitoring Agent will also be installed to the selected servers.

content.json:
## Policy Management - Compliance

This dialog allows to verify the status of the pack policies as well as Remediate the policies.

A background process remediates policies that are not compliant every 6 hours as well.

content.query:
policyresources | where type == "microsoft.policyinsights/policystates" | extend policyName=tostring(properties.policyDefinitionName), complianceState=properties.complianceState
| join (policyresources | where type == "microsoft.authorization/policydefinitions" and isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks) | project policyId=id, policyName=name, pack=tostring(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)) on policyName
| project policyId, policyName, complianceState=tostring(complianceState), pack,type='Policy'
| union( policyresources
| where type =~ 'Microsoft.PolicyInsights/PolicyStates'
| extend complianceState = tostring(properties.complianceState)
| extend
	resourceId = tostring(properties.resourceId),
	policyAssignmentId = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentId),
	policyAssignmentScope = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentScope),
	policyAssignmentName = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentName),
	policyDefinitionId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionId),
    policySetDefinitionId=tostring(properties.policySetDefinitionId),
	policyDefinitionReferenceId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionReferenceId),
	stateWeight = iff(complianceState == 'NonCompliant', int(300), iff(complianceState == 'Compliant', int(200), iff(complianceState == 'Conflict', int(100), iff(complianceState == 'Exempt', int(50), int(0)))))
| summarize max(stateWeight) by resourceId, policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| summarize counts = count() by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, max_stateWeight, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| summarize overallStateWeight = max(max_stateWeight),
nonCompliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 300),
compliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 200),
conflictCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 100),
exemptCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 50) by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| extend totalResources = todouble(nonCompliantCount + compliantCount + conflictCount + exemptCount)
| extend compliancePercentage = iff(totalResources == 0, todouble(100), 100 * todouble(compliantCount + exemptCount) / totalResources)
| project policyAssignmentName, scope = policyAssignmentScope,policySetDefinitionId,
complianceState = iff(overallStateWeight == 300, 'nonCompliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 200, 'Compliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 100, 'conflict', iff(overallStateWeight == 50, 'exempt', 'notstarted')))),
compliancePercentage,
compliantCount,
nonCompliantCount,
conflictCount,
exemptCount
| where isnotempty(policySetDefinitionId)
| join (policyresources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions' and isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)
| extend policySetDefinitionId=tostring(id)) on policySetDefinitionId
| project policyId=policySetDefinitionId, policyName=name,complianceState,pack='N/A', type='Set')

This task will trigger a tenant wide check for policy compliance.

This Task will trigger remediation for the policies in the list that are considered not compliant at this time.

## Installed Policies and Initiatives with Assignments

Once one or more policies are selected, the diaglog of scopes (subscriptions and management groups) is displayed along with the respective buttons.

content.query:
policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policydefinitions"
| where  isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project Name=name, Type='Policy',['id'],Pack=tostring(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)
| join kind = leftouter (policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policyassignments"
| project AssignmentName=name,scope=properties.scope,PolicyId=tostring(properties.policyDefinitionId), PolicyName=split(properties.PolicyId,"/")[8]
| join kind=leftouter  (policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policydefinitions"
| where  isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)) on $left.PolicyId == $right.id
| project tostring(AssignmentName),Name=tostring(split(PolicyId,"/")[8]), PolicyId,ScopeLevel=iff(scope contains 'subscriptions',"Sub", "MG"), Scope=scope) on Name
| project-away Name1, id
| union ( policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions"
| where  isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project Name=name, Type='Initiative',['id'],Pack="_N/A"
| join kind = leftouter (policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policyassignments"
| project AssignmentName=name,scope=properties.scope,PolicyId=tostring(properties.policyDefinitionId), PolicyName=split(properties.PolicyId,"/")[8]
| join kind=leftouter  (policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions"
| where  isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)) on $left.PolicyId == $right.id
| project tostring(AssignmentName),Name=tostring(split(PolicyId,"/")[8]), PolicyId, ScopeLevel=iff(scope contains 'subscriptions',"Sub", "MG"),Scope=scope) on Name
| project-away Name1, id)
| sort by Pack asc, AssignmentName asc

content.query:
Resources
| where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines' and tolower(tags.Vendor) != 'databricks'
| extend
    JoinID = toupper(id),
    OSType = tostring(properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType)
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where ( type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions') and name in ('AzureMonitorLinuxAgent', 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent')
    | extend
        State= tolower(properties.provisioningState),
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        ExtensionName = name,
        UpgradeEnabled =  tostring(properties.enableAutomaticUpgrade)
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where ( type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions') and name in ('DependencyAgentWindows','DependencyAgentLinux')
    | extend
        State= tolower(properties.provisioningState),
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        DepAgent = name,
        UpgradeEnabled =  tostring(properties.enableAutomaticUpgrade)
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId
| union (Resources
| where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines' and tolower(tags.Vendor) != 'databricks'
| extend
    JoinID = toupper(id),
    OSType = tostring(properties.osType)
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions' and name in ('AzureMonitorLinuxAgent', 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent')
    | extend
        State= tolower(properties.provisioningState),
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        ExtensionName = name,
        UpgradeEnabled =  tostring(properties.enableAutomaticUpgrade)
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions' and name in ('DependencyAgentWindows','DependencyAgentLinux')
    | extend
        State= tolower(properties.provisioningState),
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        DepAgent = name,
        UpgradeEnabled =  tostring(properties.enableAutomaticUpgrade)
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId)
| summarize by id, OSType, ['Dependency Agent']=iff(isempty(DepAgent),'N/A',DepAgent),ExtensionName=iff(isempty(ExtensionName),'N/A',ExtensionName), ['AMA State']=State, ['AMA Upg']=UpgradeEnabled,['Subscription']=subscriptionId,['Resource Group']=resourceGroup, location
| extend Install=iff(ExtensionName=='N/A','Install',iff(['AMA State']<> 'succeeded','Unhealthy','')), Uninstall=iff((ExtensionName<>'N/A') and (['AMA State'] == 'succeeded'),'Uninstall',iff(['AMA State'] <> 'succeeded','Warning',''))

compliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 200),
conflictCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 100),
exemptCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 50) by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| extend totalResources = todouble(nonCompliantCount + compliantCount + conflictCount + exemptCount)
| extend compliancePercentage = iff(totalResources == 0, todouble(100), 100 * todouble(compliantCount + exemptCount) / totalResources)
| project policyAssignmentName, scope = policyAssignmentScope,policySetDefinitionId,
complianceState = iff(overallStateWeight == 300, 'nonCompliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 200, 'Compliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 100, 'conflict', iff(overallStateWeight == 50, 'exempt', 'notstarted')))),
compliancePercentage,
compliantCount,
nonCompliantCount,
conflictCount,
exemptCount
| where isnotempty(policySetDefinitionId)
| join (policyresources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions' and properties.metadata.MonitoringPackType=='Discovery'
| extend policySetDefinitionId=tostring(id)) on policySetDefinitionId
| project Name=name,State=complianceState, type='Set',policyId=policySetDefinitionId)
content.title: Assignment Status (Compliance) - Discovery

armActionContext.title: Rmediate policies
armActionContext.description:
# Please confirm remediation

This button will trigger a global policy remeadiation. 

The backend script will go through the policies and initiatives, finding the ones that are not compliant, and will trigger remediation. 

It is not restricted to the ones in this screen.

content.json:
## Policy Compliance Check
This task will trigger a tenant wide check for policy compliance.

## Policy Remediation

This Task will trigger remediation for the policies in the list that are considered not compliant at this time.

parameters.name: Computer
parameters.query:
Discovery_CL
| parse RawData with timestamp "," rest1
| extend Computer=split(_ResourceId,'/')[8],timestamp=todatetime(timestamp)
| summarize by tostring(Computer)
parameters.label: Select Server

content.query:
let maxts=Discovery_CL | summarize timestamp=max(tostring(split(RawData,",")[0]));
Discovery_CL
| extend Computer=tostring(split(_ResourceId,'/')[8])//,timestamp=todatetime(timestamp)
| extend fields=split(RawData,",")
| extend timestamp=todatetime(fields[0])
| extend type=tostring(fields[1])
| extend platform=tostring(fields[2])
| extend OSVersion=tostring(fields[3])
| extend name=tostring(fields[4])
| extend othertype=tostring(fields[5])
| extend vendor=tostring(fields[6])
| where timestamp == toscalar(maxts)
| project timestamp,Computer,type,name,platform,OSVersion,othertype,vendor

content.title: Invocations

content.query:
union traces
| union exceptions
| where operation_Id == '{operationid}'
| where customDimensions['InvocationId'] == '{invocationid}'
| order by timestamp asc
| project
    timestamp,
    message = iff(message != '', message, iff(innermostMessage != '', innermostMessage, customDimensions.[strcat('prop__{','OriginalFormat}')])),
    logLevel = customDimensions.['LogLevel']

alertlist.alertRuleDescription: Log Alert for Virtual Machine Data Disk Read Latency (ms)
alertlist.query:
InsightsMetrics
| where Origin == "vm.azm.ms"
| where Namespace == "LogicalDisk" and Name == "ReadLatencyMs"
| extend Disk=tostring(todynamic(Tags)["vm.azm.ms/mountId"])
| where Disk !in ('C:','/')
| summarize AggregatedValue = avg(Val) by bin(TimeGenerated,15m), Computer, _ResourceId, Disk

| where Disk !in ('C:','/')

| where Origin == "vm.azm.ms"
